name: Kled
title: the Cantankerous Cavalier

P.name: Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard

effects.description: Innate: Kled rides his semi-trusty mount, Skaarl. While Mounted, all damage dealt to the duo is suffered by Skaarl, who has 400 : 1550 (based on level) base health; additional sources of health are applied to Skaarl's maximum health. Effects based on percentage health consider Kled and Skaarl's combined maximum health.

Being reduced below 0 health causes Skaarl to flee, forcing Kled to be Dismounted, with all damage in excess of Skaarl's health being ignored. Upon dismounting, Kled lunges in the direction of the allied Nexus, though not through terrain, cleanses himself of all crowd control and becomes unable to act, untargetable, and immune to crowd control for 0.5 seconds. Dismounting resets the cooldown and charges of Pocket Pistol.

While Kled is Dismounted, his base health and base movement speed are reduced; however, he gains bonus movement speed while moving toward enemy champions. Additionally, his base attack range is increased and his attacks deal 80% damage to champions. Bear Trap on a Rope is replaced with Pocket Pistol, while Jousting and Chaaaaaaaarge!!! become unusable.

P.notes:
Kled and  Skaarl's health bar is split in two segments, representing each of them respectively.
Kled's health is rounded up while  Skaarl's health is rounded down.
The rounding is only visual and bears no effect on gameplay.
If Kled takes  fatal damage while affected by  Renata Glasc's  Bailout, he will appear to have a unified health bar instead.(bug)
The unification is only visual and bears no effect on gameplay.
Reconnecting to the game will restore the split health bar.
While untargetable, Kled will  destroy allied projectiles in addition to enemy projectiles.(bug)
 Health regeneration and  healing affects either only Kled's or  Skaarl's health, prioritizing  Skaarl's health until full.
Excess damage dealt to  Skaarl counts for the purposes of effects based on damage dealt (eg.  Death's Dance's Ignore Pain,  Stormsurge's Squall, item damage trackers).(note)
If  Skaarl's health is reduced below 0 by  Eclipse's Ever Rising Moon, Kled will take the triggering attack's damage.(note)
Dismounting will remove  Speed Shrine's movement speed buff from Kled and prevent him from regaining it for the next 5 seconds, even if he remounts or enters the shrine again.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST:  Lulu's  Wild Growth will restore an excess of its bonus health value to Kled and  Skaarl.(bug)
 Wild Growth's bonus health increase will be applied to  Skaarl's maximum health, as intended.
The  lunge can pass through  Yorick's  Dark Procession.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: When undoing an item purchase, a champion's current health and mana will be increased or decreased to their value at the time of the item being purchased, then on  classic maps they will additionally be increased based on how much health and mana the fountain would have restored during the time the item was in the champion's inventory.
As a consequence, buying items while Kled and  Skaarl's combined current health is lower than Kled's maximum health will cause Kled to dismount upon undoing the purchase and potentially lose health.(note)
The following table refers for interactions while Kled is lunging:

P.blurb: Innate:  Kled rides his semi-trusty steed,  Skaarl, whom takes damage for him while he is Mounted. When  Skaarl's health depletes, Kled dismounts,  cleansing from all  crowd control.

P.name: Dismounted Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard

effects.description: Innate: Kled is only vulnerable to death while Dismounted. Kled has 410 : 1838 (based on level) base health, which is not improved by sources of bonus health, as well as reduced base movement speed and increased base attack range. Effects based on percentage health consider Kled and Skaarl's combined maximum health, meaning that a Dismounted Kled is never considered to be at full health.

Kled gains 100 : 185 (based on level) bonus movement speed while moving towards and after attacking visible enemy champions within 1000 units, but his basic attacks against them are reduced to 80% AD physical damage. Additionally, he gains the ability to restore Skaarl's Courage to mount again.

Innate - Courage: Kled gains 15 Courage after completing a basic attack against a champion, 20 Courage whenever he scores a takedown against an enemy champion within 3 seconds of damaging them, 4 Courage for minion kills, and 5 Courage when basic attacking a structure or epic monster. At 100 Courage, Skaarl returns with 45 / 55 / 65 / 75% (based on level) of Skaarl's maximum health and Kled becomes Mounted after 0.7 seconds. Mounting up resets the cooldowns of Bear Trap on a Rope and Jousting.
While at the allied fountain, 25 Courage is generated every 0.25 seconds. If reuniting outside of base, Skaarl gets Frayed Nerves, which prevents him from gaining Courage for several seconds.

The current status of Kled's own health is preserved between subsequent dismounts. While Mounted, healing and health regeneration will first replenish Skaarl's health and will only apply to Kled's health while Skaarl is at full health.

P.notes:
Clones are counted as champions for all of this passive's effects, other than the takedown one.
Kled will retain the bonus movement speed buff for 1.5 seconds while moving towards an enemy champion even if that champion is no longer  visible.
After completing a basic attack on a champion, the bonus movement speed buff is granted for 1.5 seconds regardless of whether he is moving towards a  visible enemy or not.
Kled will neither gain Courage nor bonus movement speed if his basic attack is  dodged,  blocked,  missed or  parried.
It is possible to get the Courage from base but have Kled and  Skaarl reunite out of base.
If Kled achieves 100 Courage while  resurrecting or enters it while in the process of remounting, the remount will be deferred to after he revives.
Sources of increased maximum health that additionally restore current health will restore Kled's current health even if he is DISMOUNTED.
Becoming Mounted will interrupt Kled's ongoing attack windup.
The Courage bar is white when under 100 courage and turns red at 100 courage.
Prior to V13.10, the Courage bar would turn yellow when equal to or above 50 courage.(note)
P.blurb: Innate: While Dismounted,  Kled suffers all damage taken and is vulnerable to  death. Kled's base health cannot be improved through any means, his movement speed is reduced, and his basic attacks against  champions deal less physical damage. However, Kled gains a large amount of bonus movement speed when moving toward  visible enemy champions, and he has the ability to restore  Skaarl's  Courage to  mount again.

Q.name: Bear Trap on a Rope

effects.description: Active: Kled throws a bear trap in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies hit, increased by 50% against minions and small monsters. The bear trap collides against the first enemy champion, large pet or large monster hit, forming a tether between Kled and the target for 1.75 seconds, during which they are revealed.

The tether's radius shrinks over its duration, and if it is not broken before then, Kled pulls the target 100 units toward him, deals physical damage, inflicts Grievous Wounds for 5 seconds, and slows them for 1.5 seconds.
Bear Trap on a Rope can be cast while Jousting.

Q.notes:
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
The visual effect of Bear Trap on a Rope will appear at Kled's height at the end of cast time and may not portray its  projectile accurately if Kled is  dismounting at the end of cast time.
PENDING FOR TEST: Is the same true if Kled is  airborne?
Applies  spell damage to enemy champions and large monsters, while applying  area damage to all other enemy units.
 Tibbers,  Daisy and  The Maiden are considered  large pets.
All other pets are considered  minions for the purposes of this ability.
Bear Trap on a Rope will not  pull the target if they are in  stasis.
The tether cannot be broken within the first 0.25 seconds of its application.
 Rek'Sai's  Void Rush will break the tether upon the beginning of its cast time.(bug)
This ability's damage is calculated based on the caster's stats at the time of its initial application and does not change dynamically.
 Count Kledula has no sound cue for when the tether is broken.(bug)
Q.blurb: Active:  Kled throws a bear trap in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies hit and forms a  tether against the first  champion or  large monster hit,  revealing them.

Q.name: Pocket Pistol

effects.description: Active: Kled sprays a cone of five pellets in the target direction while recoiling 300 units in the opposite direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit.
Kled periodically stocks a Pocket Pistol charge, up to a maximum of 2. He will restore both charges when dismounting.

Pellets collide with the first enemy champion they hit, and deal 20% damage per pellet beyond the first. Each pellet that hits an enemy champion or epic monster restores Courage, by 5 and 2.5 respectively, for up to a total restore of 25 against champions and 12.5 versus epic monsters.

Q.notes:
The backwards  dash from Pocket Pistol can pass terrain.
Pocket Pistol can be cast while  grounded or  rooted but Kled will not  dash backwards.
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
 Black Cleaver will specifically apply a stack for every pellet hit.
 Spell shield will negate multiple pellets if they hit at the same time.
Even if the first pellet is negated, subsequent non-negated pellets will still only deal 20% of the damage.
Pellets will restore Courage when colliding with units protected by  spell shield, but will not restore Courage when colliding with  Fiora's  Riposte.
PENDING FOR TEST: Pocket Pistol will have no charges if Kled  dismounts and triggers  Transcendence at the same time.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: Pocket Pistol will falsely visually appear to have another charge ready if the end of its cast time coincides with a charge being stocked.(bug)
Q.blurb: Active:  Kled sprays a cone of pellets in the target direction that deal physical damage to enemies hit, during which he also  recoils backward. Each pellet that hits an enemy  champion or epic  monster restores  Courage.

W.name: Violent Tendencies

effects.description: Passive: Kled periodically gains Violent Tendencies, which starts expiring upon his next basic attack.
Violent Tendencies: Kled gains 150% bonus attack speed on his next 4 basic attacks within 4 seconds. The fourth attack deals bonus physical damage, capped against monsters.

units: % (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Against structures, the fourth attack deals modified bonus physical damage.

W.notes:
Violent Tendencies' bonus damage is applied as a separate damage instance from the attack that triggers it.
Violent Tendencies' bonus damage is tagged as  basic damage and  spell damage, which allows it to trigger spell effects.
Attacking a plant will not cause Violent Tendencies to begin expiring.
Attacking a plant will still count as one of the 4 attacks if Violent Tendencies is already expiring.
While  dismounted, the bonus physical damage of Violent Tendencies can be negated by  Silence and  Forced Actions.(bug)
The special attack animations and sounds of Violent Tendencies are then replaced with default ones.
Learning Violent Tendencies will cancel Kled's ongoing attack windup.
In contrast, Violent Tendencies coming off cooldown during an ongoing attack windup will not cancel it.
Successfully finishing the basic attack will then cause Violent Tendencies to begin expiring, but will not count as one of the 4 attacks.
W.blurb: Passive:  Kled periodically gains Violent Tendencies, which starts expiring upon his next basic attack.

E.name: Jousting

effects.description: Active: Skaarl dashes in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing physical damage to enemies he passes through and pulling minions and small monsters hit towards them.

Upon hitting an enemy champion or large monster, Skaarl dashes a fixed 200 units through them, marking them for 3 seconds, during which they are revealed. After the dash ends, the duo gain 50% bonus movement speed for 1 second. Jousting can be recast after 0.5 seconds of the first dash ending while the target is marked.
Recast: Skaarl consumes the mark to dash through the marked target, applying the same effects as the first cast though being able to dash through terrain.
The mark will remain even if the target dies, and ends prematurely if the duo are too far away or Kled dismounts.
Bear Trap on a Rope and Chaaaaaaaarge!!! can be cast during either of the dashes.

E.notes:
Kled can use his summoner spells and item actives while  dashing.
Jousting will go on cooldown at the end of its first dash, but its cooldown cannot be reduced by cooldown refunding effects such as  Transcendence while its mark is active.(note)
Both casts count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as  Spellblade and triggering  Force Pulse's passive.
All  pets are considered  minions for the purposes of this ability.
Casting  Chaaaaaaaarge!!! during Jousting will not interrupt the dash.
Recasting Jousting while outside of maximum range will cause the ability to go on cooldown without activation.
When recasting Jousting,  Skaarl will  Dash to the marked target's location at the time of recasting and will then  Dash another 200 units.
The 200 unit dash cannot pass through terrain.
If the marked target's location at the time of recasting happens to be inside terrain, Jousting will end upon reaching terrain.
The first dash can enter terrain within a short radius.
This allows Kled to sometimes pass through  Yorick's  Dark Procession with the first cast of Jousting.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: the first dash's terrain forgiveness radius
Jousting can be recast even while the target is  untargetable or  dead.
PENDING FOR TEST: Jousting's hitbox
E.blurb: Active:   Skaarl  dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies he passes through and marking enemy  champions hit. The mark  reveals the target for a short time, during which Jousting can be recast.

effects.description: This ability is unusable while dismounted.

R.name: Chaaaaaaaarge!!!

effects.description: Active: Kled & Skaarl charge toward the target location, automatically navigating terrain along the way, during which they're ghosted, immune to crowd control and revealed to enemy champions in a 1250 radius. If the charge does not complete within 15 seconds, it will end prematurely. The charge is interrupted instantly if Kled dismounts during it.

While charging, the duo gain bonus movement speed and a shield for every 0.25 seconds of traveling, up to 950 total movement speed over 3 seconds and 10% : 100% (based on time traveling) of the maximum shield amount over 2.25 seconds respectively. The shield lasts for 2 seconds upon finishing the charge. The duo trails a directional draft in their wake, lasting 9 seconds. Allied units other than lane minions and Voidmites following the draft gain Mr. Kled's Wild Ride.

Mr. Kled's Wild Ride: While in champion combat, gain 40% bonus movement speed. After not being in champion combat for 3 seconds, if Kled is charging, gain bonus movement speed up to Kled's current movement speed; otherwise gain up to 650 total movement speed.

Kled & Skaarl will dash toward the first visible enemy champion in range of the charge, revealing the target during the dash and colliding with the first visible enemy champion in their path to deal physical damage, increased by 0% : 200% (based on charge time), knocking them back 100 units and ending the charge.

R.notes:
During the charge the duo gain (950 − (starting movement speed)) ÷ 12 × (time ÷ 0.25) bonus movement speed
The bonus movement speed is not affected by movement speed caps.
The charge will not give any movement speed to the duo if they have more than [ 1440 raw movement speed ][ 950 after movement speed soft caps ].
The trail will not give Kled and his allies any movement speed out-of-champion-combat if they have more than [ 840 raw movement speed ][ 650 after movement speed soft caps ].
Movement speed is granted by facing the direction of the draft and lasts for 0.528 seconds seconds upon exiting the trail or facing another direction.
Kled's charge path will be similar to the path he would take if ordered to move to the target location instead.
Kled will re-path if his current path is blocked by a newly created terrain (either player created or by the  Mountainous Rift).
The charge will continue towards the target location even if Kled's location changes drastically.
Kled will mark his path with an indicator visible to him and his allies.
Kled's pathing indicator will not account for changes in Kled's pathing.
Kled's pathing indicator will sometimes display a path different from his real path.(bug)
 Axiom Arcanist will only increase the first instance of the shield gained.(bug)
While charging, Kled will check for enemy  champions within 500 range in a 180° arc in his facing direction. If any are found, he will look for  visible enemy champions in 800 range in the same arc. If any are found, after 0.5 to 0.11 seconds, he will he will begin  dashing to the closest visible enemy champion.
If the charge ends before, or during the dash,(bug) the dash will not:
Generate a shield;
Grant  immunity to crowd control;
Trail a directional draft, applying Mr. Kled's Wild Ride;
Disable summoner spells and items.
 Zeke's Convergence's Frostfire Tempest will trigger at the end of the charge or at the end of the dash, whichever comes last.
Frostfire Tempest will trigger at the end of the dash even if the charge ends before or during the dash, unlike other charge-related interactions.
Kled and  Skaarl will track the target if they change locations.
They will dash to the target's previous location if the target is too far away or moves beyond 2500 units of the dash's beginning location.
If the dash does not complete within 9 seconds, Kled and  Skaarl will continue to track their target and be able to cast spells, but will not able to collide with enemy champions.
The damage dealt is based on time spent traveling before the beginning of the dash.
Chaaaaaaaarge!!!'s  knockback distance and speed may be impeded by terrain.
The  debuff is removed early when the forced movement stops.

Buffering Interactions

Nothing can be buffered during the charge.
Movement and attack commands, as well as  Bear Trap on a Rope and  Jousting can be buffered during the dash.
R.blurb: Active: Kled &  Skaarl become  ghosted and  unstoppably charge to a location, building up  bonus movement speed and  shield and leaving a draft in their wake that grants Mr. Kled's Wild Ride to allies that follow the draft.

effects.description: This ability is unusable while dismounted.

lore: A warrior as fearless as he is ornery, the yordle Kled embodies the furious bravado of Noxus. He is an icon beloved by the empire's soldiers, distrusted by its officers, and loathed by the nobility. Many claim Kled has fought in every campaign the legions have waged, has “acquired” every military title, and has never once backed down from a fight. Though the truth of the matter is often questionable, one part of his legend is undeniable: Charging into battle on his un-trusty steed, Skaarl, Kled fights to protect what's his… and to take whatever he can get.

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: A warrior as fearless as he is ornery, the yordle Kled embodies the furious bravado of Noxus. He is an icon beloved by the empire’s soldiers, distrusted by its officers, and loathed by the nobility. Many claim Kled has fought in every campaign the legions have waged, has 'acquired' every military title, and has never once backed down from a fight. Though the truth of the matter is often questionable, one part of his legend is undeniable: Charging into battle on his un-trusty steed, Skaarl, Kled fights to protect what’s his… and to take whatever he can get.

skins.name: Sir
skins.lore: Sir Prince Chevalier Archduke Lord Double-Earl Kled (or Sir Kled, for short) is a half-mad knight from the aptly named Kingdom of Kled, which contains exactly two subjects: Kled, and his cowardly avian mount, Skarl. Together, the pair ravage the countryside to 'reclaim' Kled's 'land', which apparently is… all land, everywhere.

skins.name: Count Kledula

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive during 2018.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive during 2018.

skins.lore: This blood is MY blood. This candy is MY candy. Who sent you here?! You're not real ghosts! I'm Count Baron Double-Marquis Lord Duke Kledula… AND I'LL TEACH YOU NOT TO TRICK-OR-TREAT ON MY LAND!

skins.name: Marauder

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2021.

skins.lore: Throughout history, the Marauders have balanced on the knife's edge between brutality and cunning. General Kled, one half of the pair that currently leads the regime, is truly the incarnation of their historic brutality… and little more. If it weren't for Xin Zhao, Kled would bet everything on a final, bloody, battle.

skins.name: Kibble-Head

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2023.

skins.lore: He's just a lil' guy wearing a bowl of Poro-Pup Chow as a hat, riding the bestest beagle into battle. The get-up won Kled and Skaarl a blue ribbon at Beagle's Bridge, so if ain't broke, don't fix it. Here's hoping that the more "refined" judges at this year's Summoner Sweetie's Pet Show agree.
